question: Which two nations share the location of "Krkonose Mountain Range"?
explanation: The Czech Republic and Poland share the location of Krkonose Mountain Range. This mountain range is also known as the Giant Mountains. It forms part of the Sudetes Mountain System. It runs across the Czech-Polish border. It forms the source of the Elbe River. It is a UNESCO Man and Biosphere Programme's Biosphere Reserve and it houses Krkonose National Park of the Czech Republic and Karkonosze National Park of Poland.
